definition: to regard sth as a plaything (idiom); to consider unimportant/to view as trifling

sentences.english: My employer treated our request as a joke.
sentences.chinese: 我的老闆把我們的要求視爲兒戲。

sentences.english: Our employer treated our suggestions as a joke.
sentences.chinese: 我們的僱主把我們的建議視爲兒戲。

sentences.english: They are another example of the futility of marriage between big stars in Tinseltown.
sentences.chinese: 他們再次證明了好萊塢大明星們視婚姻如兒戲。

sentences.english: There are climbing high line want back wages, it really is just a joke?
sentences.chinese: 還有爬高壓線想要回工錢，難道真的僅是一場兒戲？

sentences.english: Event of lifelong significance, usually refers to marriage.
sentences.chinese: 這可是他的終身大事，不可兒戲。

sentences.english: Personal grudges and family feuds continue to make playthings of issues.
sentences.chinese: 由於個人嫌隙與家庭仇恨，國家大事被視同兒戲。

sentences.english: He wielded his pen almost as if it were a toy.
sentences.chinese: 他揮動如椽之筆，如同兒戲一般。

sentences.english: It is more like a children's game than a real issue of life and death.
sentences.chinese: 這與其說是真正的生死搏鬥，不如說更象一場兒戲。

definition: to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to force someone to do something
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
